revised_title: Gauss-Matuyama Polarity Transition: Insights from Searles Valley Core
tldr: The study investigates the Gauss-Matuyama polarity transition in a 9 cm rotary-drilled core from Searles Valley, California. The transition is estimated to have lasted approximately 2000 years, and the relative field intensity decreased by at least 70% during the transition. The virtual geomagnetic poles path for the Gauss-Matuyama transition is restricted to a meridional band 20' wide in the Atlantic Ocean, indicating that the transition field associated with the reversal was dominated by non-dipole components.
